content.description:
The table gives the values of selected accounts in a nation’s balance of payments in millions of dollars.
 Exports <math alttext="$500" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Imports <math alttext="$400" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>400</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Net income from abroad <math alttext="negative $150" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>$</mi><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Net unilateral transfers <math alttext="$20" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Based on the table, the nation’s trade balance is equal to which of the following?

unit.text: 6: Open Economy - International Trade and Finance

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
